newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil supermarket chain Bompreco plans IPO.
newsitem.headline: Brazil supermarket chain Bompreco plans IPO.

text.p: Supermarket chain Bompreco is set to launch an initial public offering of $100 million of stock on international and domestic markets, a company spokeswoman said.
The global offering is being coordinated by private bank Bradesco and investment bank Lehman Brothers, she said.
She said Bompreco President Joao Carlos Paes Mendonca and Market Relations Director Marcelo Silva are conducting a "road show" this week in Europe and the United States.
Proceeds from the IPO will be used to finance modernization and expansion, she said.
Bompreco, based in northeast Brazil, is the country's fourth largest supermarket chain, said Brazil's Association of Supermarkets (ABRAS).
